name: Whirlpool
author: CrusaderDroid
desc:
You create a whirlpool of swirling water that occupies a 30 foot radius cylinder 30 feet tall, with the center having a radius of 10 feet. Creatures in the area and who enter the area must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be dragged as close to the center as possible.

A creature that starts their turn while totally submerged must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they take 6d6 damage and have 1d4 hit dice destroyed. On a success, they take half damage and only have half the hit dice destroyed, rounded down. A creature with insufficient hit dice is vulnerable to the damage taken and has that damage deducted from maximum hit points.

The whirlpool is difficult terrain. Creatures without a swim speed must succeed on a Strength saving throw at the end of each turn while inside or be dragged back 5 feet closer to the center.

If created in water, the whirlpool's radius becomes 60 feet instead. Vehicles trapped in the center of the whirlpool take damage equal to one quarter of their maximum hit points every 6 seconds.
